intro: Psychotria castaneopila, commonly known as the red-eyed wonder, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers with yellow centers, which are highly attractive to pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded environments, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Psychotria castaneopila is also noted for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in local herbal remedies.
